name: Aske Plaat
content: Aske Plaat | Leiden University Professor  Department of Artificial Intelligence & Computer Science (LIACS)Leiden University, Snellius 158Niels Bohrweg 1, 2333 CA Leiden, The Netherlands Research InterestsI am professor in artificial intelligence at the Institute of Artificial Intelligence and Computer Science (LIACS) of  Leiden University, the Netherlands, where I head, with Thomas Moerland, the Sustainable Energy Learning Lab and the Reinforcement Learning Group.  I am interested in large language models, music, and self-learning systems. Please have a look at my books: learning to play deep reinforcement learning BioI studied artificial intelligence with Jonathan Schaeffer at the University of Alberta, Edmonton and Arie de Bruin & Wim Pijls at the Erasmus University, Rotterdam where I obtained my PhD in 1996. I worked with Charles Leiserson at the MIT Lab for Computer Science, Cambridge, Massachusetts, on the Cilk parallel computing system. Later I worked with Henri Bal at VU Amsterdam on scalable algorithms. In 2014 I joined Leiden University. From 2016-2023 I served two terms as scientific director of LIACS. Longer Bio.
